Html: I'm trying to install on my host but I get "Directory Listing Denied" I've read that I may need to have a wildcard extension setup for IIS6 to handle extension-less files but my host says that this is a security risk and won't do it. Is this indeed the reason that I'm getting this message and if so, is there another way to get the app to work? Thanks!

I contacted my host provider and they say they have the most recent asp.net 3.5 SP1 extensions and that their environment is a full trust hosting environment, so does anyone know why I'm getting "Directory Listing Denied"?

Thanks
Ask them if they are hosting any Microsoft MVC applications for anyone else. There are specific requirements for MVC (which KiGG uses) and IIS needs to be properly setup.
